<title level="1" right="Spell 6" pfs="Standard">[True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Revelation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=138" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 378 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Spell Lists**
[Elemental](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=5)

**Bloodlines**
[Diabolic](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=4), [Genie](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=11), [Harrow](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=18)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 10 minutes
</row>

</column>

---

You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).
name: True Seeing
